1.title: How to Make a Tropical Brunch Pt. 1
1.plot: Its all about Lemons. Join Darviny as she sets the stage to a fabulous tropical brunch with one of her signature tablescapes. She shares her inside secrets to entertaining and her love for all things "patina."

2.title: How to Make a Tropical Brunch Pt. 2
2.plot: Welcome back to Darviny's kitchen. Now that the table is set for her Tropical Brunch, Darviny creates 3 easy Salads for her "ladies who lunch."

3.title: The Love, Darviny Show - Tropical Fruit & Tablescapes
3.plot: The most beautiful thing about Florida, aside from the weather. Are all the beautiful colors and flavors in the keys. Darviny shares her favorite tropical fruits with us and uses the unique colors of the tropics to paint her latest "Tablescapes."

4.title: The Love, Darviny Show - How to Make a "JUST DO IT!" Smoothie
4.plot: After a visit to the famous "Robert is Here" Fruit stand, Darviny brings home a basket full of flavors to create her "Just Do It!" Smoothie. Make a delicious smoothie with Darviny and cool down from the heat of the day.

5.title: Darviny Tablescapes - The Greek Zen Table
5.plot: Join Darviny as she presents one of her unique "Tablescapes!" Remember " Use What You Have!" Here Darviny sets a Greek-Zen themed table with some of her favorite elements from her home.

6.title: The Love, Darviny Show - How to Make Fish Like a Floridian
6.plot: Join Darviny as she takes an adventure to the local fish shop in the keys and takes it home to make a delicious tropical fish dish. There's nothing better than fresh fish in the Florida Keys and Darviny adds her signature flavor to make a unique meal for her guests.

7.title: The Love, Darviny Show - How to Cook Like a French Gourmande
7.plot: Welcome back to Darviny's kitchen where she is making one of her family recipes with "Pomme de Terre" (potatoes). By the time she's done, you'll already be a French Gourmande.

8.title: The Love, Darviny Show - Celebrating Gratitude
8.plot: Down by the dock with Darviny, celebrating Gratitude and taking moments to enjoy everything around us. What are you grateful for today?

9.title: The Love, Darviny Show - How to Cook Like a French Gourmande Part Deux
9.plot: We are back in the kitchen with Darviny as she finishes part two of her french cooking special. Today we make the main course, which is a quick and easy chicken recipe. Delicious.

10.title: The Love, Darviny Show - The Enjoyment of Imperfection
10.plot: Hang outside with Darviny as she celebrates the enjoyment of imperfection. She shares her recipe for her signature Dar-Water and discusses the joys of enjoying life to the fullest.

11.title: The Love, Darviny Show - A Kale Salad for Everyone
11.plot: Darviny is back in the kitchen and is preparing a dinner for 8. Healthy, delicious, and full of flavor, Darviny whips a hearty Kale Salad that everyone can agree on.

12.title: The Love, Darviny Show - How to Make Sauteed Shrimp & Pasta
12.plot: Join Darviny back in the kitchen as she whips up a delicious Shrimp and Pasta dish that will leave your guests wanting more.

13.title: The Love, Darviny Show - Fruit & Spice Park
13.plot: Take a journey with Darviny into the Fruit and Spice Park in the Florida redlands. Discover the multiple types of mangoes, jackfruit, and other exotic fruits and spices unique to the Florida Keys.

14.title: The Love, Darviny Show - How to Make Coconut Fish
14.plot: Darviny is back in the kitchen and this time she has a Sous Chef. Darviny's daughter, Lexi, joins her in making coconut fish with mango salsa. A quick and easy recipe perfect for a light dinner.

15.title: The Love, Darviny Show - Off to the Redlands
15.plot: We are off to the Redlands. Darviny is touring through the Florida Redlands and has stumbled upon something most unique, a tropical winery. Join Darviny at Schebly's Redland Winery for a wine tasting unlike any other.

16.title: The Love, Darviny Show - Off to the Redlands pt. 2
16.plot: Darviny is still in the Redlands, tasting her way through Schebly Redlands' Winery. She gets a one on one exclusive with the founder of the tropical winery and what inspired him to create fruit wine.
